title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.28 | 18-06-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya
Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jaya Mudhirayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 28th verse of the 10th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavad Gita.
The meaning of this verse is
O friends, just think of his wives
whose hands he had to bear to marry her.
How they must have undergone vows, baths, fire sacrifices
and perfect worship of the Lord of the universe
to constantly relish now the nectar from his lips by kissing.
The damsels of Raja Bhoomi would often faint
just by expecting such favours.
So among the inhabitants of Dwara,
particularly the ladies of Hastinapur are glorifying the wives of Krishna
and the gopis of Vrindavan.
They are very intimately associated with Krishna.
They are the intimate devotees of Krishna.
And they are being described here that
they are the intimate devotees of Krishna.
They are the intimate devotees of Krishna.
And they are being described here that
they do not get that position simply by desiring to have that position.
they did not get that position simply by desiring to have that position, no,
they must have undergone vows, baths, fire sacrifices and perfect worship of Krishna
who is the Lord of the universe.
Lot of tapasya they have done to get that position.
That's what is being described here.
Now,
Now,

Now Sri La Pravapada explains in the purport. Religious rites prescribed in the scriptures are meant to purify the mundane qualities of the conditioned souls. Mundane qualities means material qualities.

And these material qualities are to be purified. Because we are spirit soul, we are spiritual by nature, we have spiritual qualities which are covered by material body, by material mind, covered with material qualities.
So the religious rituals described in the scriptures are meant to purify the mundane qualities of the conditioned souls.
By these mundane qualities, these material qualities.
And what will happen if we get purified? We are gradually promoted to the stage of rendering transcendental service to the Supreme Lord Krishna.
So this purification is necessary for elevating us gradually to the stage of being able to serve Krishna, to be able to recognize.
Render devotional service to Krishna.
So devotional service is not an ordinary activity.
And not everybody can take to devotional service simply by desiring or deciding to do so. No.
There is a lot of difference between bhakti and karma.
Bhakti is completely spiritual.
Karma is material.
Karma may be performed by any human being.
But bhakti is only for those who are purified by the right process described in the scriptures, the religious rituals for purification.
And only then one can actually.
Begin devotional service to Krishna.
And only then one can actually.
Begin devotional service to Krishna.
Further Srila Prabhupada says,
Attainment of this stage of pure spiritual life is the highest perfection.
And this stage is called Swarupa.
This was mentioned in the previous verse also by Prabhupada.
Swarupa.
The factual, what is Swarupa?
The factual identity.
The factual identity.
The factual identity.
The factual identity.
The factual identity.
The factual identity.
Of the living being.
Each one of us, we have got a spiritual identity.
The spiritual identity is called Swarupa.
It's our original position in our relationship with Krishna.
In the spiritual world.
In his association.
It is a perfection.
Highest perfection to be attained.
Liberation means renovation of this stage of Swarupa.
This is what Bhagavatam describes.
Sometimes people think liberation means going to the heavenly planets.
Sometimes they think liberation means merging into some void.
Sometimes they think liberation means getting some mystic powers.
But that is not liberation.
Even though they may be desired by somebody who is suffering in this material world.
As freedom from suffering through these methods is possible to some extent.
But ultimately, real liberation is not just freedom from suffering.
Of course, those who are really liberated are free from all suffering.
But beyond that, they are established in their Swarupa, in their relationship, loving relationship
with Krishna.
In that, they are free from suffering.
And in that perfect stage of Swarupa, the living being is established in five phases
of loving service.
Five phases of loving service.
This is described in detail in the Bhakti Samrita Sindhu, which describes what is Bhakti?
What is the kind of relationship in Bhakti?
What are the different kinds of relationships?
What is the relationship between the two?
Five kinds of relationships, depending on the five kinds of service that one renders
to Krishna.
Shanta, Das, Chesav, Kya, Vatsalya, Madhurya.
Of these five, the stage of Madhurya Rasa or the humor of conjugal love is one of the
five and it is the topmost.
The Lord is always perfect in himself.
And thus he is perfect in himself.
There is no hankering for himself.
It is not that Krishna wants some enjoyment in association with the gopis or the queens,
the most beautiful personalities, because he is lacking in any way.
No, Krishna is never lacking.
Krishna is always full in himself.
Purna, he is completely full in himself.
That is the most beautiful personality.
He is the who's the greatest.
and he's independent because he's full he's independent so he is not hankering
as we the souls of this material world are always incomplete imperfect
therefore we have a hankering we want so we are lacking therefore we want
Krishna is never lacking never eternally he is full perfect completely full
Krishna however in spite of being full in himself he becomes a master a friend
a son or a husband
to fulfill the intense love of the devotee concern it is a devotees loving
service to Krishna that Krishna agrees to become the master of the loving
servant the husband of the loving wife
the son of the loving mother or loving father the friend of another loving
friend
end so Krishna agrees out of his causeless mercy out of his kindness so
in this particular description of this words two classes of devotees of the
Lord are mentioned in the stage of conjugal love the Queens and the Gopis
in Vrindavan the Queens in Dwaraka and Gopis in Vrindavan two classes of
devotees who are situated in Madhuriya-rasa relationship one is called
Swakhiya and other is called Parakhiya this is very important to understand
both of them are in conjugal love with Krishna but there is a difference the
Queens at Dwaraka were Swakhiya relationship or duly married
wives of Dwaraka.
that means there is a relationship because of being married
Krishna married 16,108 princesses and they became after marriage his
Queens in Dwaraka whereas the damsels of Vraja the Gopis young Gopis the young
friends of Lord were his friends in Vrindavan
when he was unmarried when he was a boy
the Lord stayed at Vrindavan till the age of 16 and his friendly relations with
the neighboring girls were in terms of Parakhiya. Parakhiya means it is not a
relationship of conjugal love conjugal love means love between opposite genders
male and female.
so this relationship is not with not due to marriage now these girls in Vrindavan
the Gopis young Gopis as well as the Queens underwent severe penances by
taking vows bathing and offering sacrifices in the fire as prescribed in
the scriptures how did they reach that position of becoming the beloved of Krishna.
as the queen or as the Gopis it is by undergoing severe penances that is
being described in this verse. now the rights as they are not an end in
themselves what is described in this Shastra as the tapasya or some rata or
some yagna, some dana or some yagna.

All those things are not end in themselves, but they are means to attain the highest stage of Swaroopa, including the descriptions of different pious activities, different types of cultivation of knowledge, transcendental knowledge or even perfect knowledge.
Perfection in mystic powers, getting siddhis. So, jnana, karma and siddhi, all these are not end in themselves. The ultimate perfection of these attainments is to reach the highest stage of Swaroopa.
To render constitutional transcendentalism.
To render transcendental loving service to the Lord. That is the goal.
So, we should understand carefully that the kissing of the Lord, either by his wives or the gopis, is not a material act or a material quality. No.
If it is material, then it is not a material act.
If it is material, then it is not a material act.
Then Shukadeva Goswami would never have even cared to mention it in the 10th canto of the Bhagavad Gita.
Because Shukadeva Goswami is a very very strict brahmachari.
And he is completely free from all material desires.
So, he has no interest in any material activities.
He is only interested in spiritual activities.
Therefore, Shukadeva Goswami elaborately described Krishna's pastimes.
Therefore, Shukadeva Goswami elaborately described Krishna's pastimes.
Therefore, Shukadeva Goswami elaborately described Krishna's pastimes.
And even Chaitanya Mahaprabhu participated in this subject matter, even though he was a very strict sannyasi.
And even Chaitanya Mahaprabhu participated in this subject matter, even though he was a very strict sannyasi.
So, therefore, we should understand this stage is attained only after severe penances of many many many lifetimes.
And it is a transcendental position. It is not a material position.
I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
